name: VillagerEntityHelper
description: The `VillagerEntityHelper` class provides specialized access to villager entities in Minecraft, offering methods to interact with villager-specific properties such as profession, level, and style. This class extends `MerchantEntityHelper` and inherits all trading functionality including trade offers, merchant experience, and customer status.
overview:
This helper is particularly useful for creating scripts that:
- Analyze villager professions and trading capabilities
- Monitor villager levels and experience
- Create automated trading systems based on profession
- Track village economics and specialized trades
- Find specific types of villagers for particular trades

You typically get `VillagerEntityHelper` instances from:
- Entity events involving villagers
- World entity searches filtered for villager types
- Casting from generic EntityHelper instances using type checking

methods.name: getProfession
methods.description: Returns the profession of the villager entity, typically as a namespaced ID (e.g., 'minecraft:farmer').

methods.name: getStyle
methods.description: Returns the style variant of the villager entity, which is biome-specific (e.g., 'desert', 'plains'). This primarily affects visual appearance.

methods.name: getLevel
methods.description: Returns the current trading level of the villager entity (1-5). Higher levels unlock more and better trades.
